sentences.sContent: Their claim had no basis in fact (=  it was not true  ) .
sentences.sCn: 他们的说法没有事实根据。

sentences.sContent: ...the more they will use these categories as the primary basis for understanding themselves and others...
...These should discourage retailers from wasteful practices that lead to the rejection of food on the basis of cosmetic characteristics...
...or to allocate real power on the basis of sex rather than merit...
...and gain employment have historically been denied on the basis of disability...
...and sell advertising on the basis of the traffic this generates...
...The team spirit and shared values of the athletes on Bowerman’s teams carried over and provided the basis for the collegial style of management that characterized the early years of Nikes...
...What qualities of Bowerman’s teams formed the basis of Nike’s early management style...

synos.tran: 基础；底部；主要成分；基本原则或原理

words.tran: 头盖骨底部的；[生物] 基部的

trans.tranCn: 基础， 根据； 原则
trans.tranOther: the facts, ideas, or things from which something can be developed
